zh-cn: 夏尔·安德烈·约瑟夫·马里·戴高乐
en: Charles André Joseph Marie de Gaulle

description.zh-cn: 法国军事家、政治家，法兰西第五共和国的创建者。曾在第二次世界大战期间领导自由法国运动，战后担任法兰西共和国临时政府主席，后成为法兰西第五共和国的第一任总统。
description.en: French military officer and statesman who founded the French Fifth Republic. He led the Free French Forces during World War II, served as President of the Provisional Government of the French Republic, and later became the first President of the French Fifth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 法兰西共和国的国家元首职位。
description.en: The office of the head of state of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，曾在夏尔·戴高乐总统任内担任总理。
description.en: French politician who served as Prime Minister under President Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，曾在夏尔·戴高乐总统任内担任总理，后接替戴高乐成为法国总统。
description.en: French politician who served as Prime Minister under President Charles de Gaulle and later succeeded him as President of France.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，曾在夏尔·戴高乐总统任内担任总理。
description.en: French politician who served as Prime Minister under President Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，法兰西第四共和国最后一任总统，其总统职位由夏尔·戴高乐接替。
description.en: French politician and the last President of the French Fourth Republic, succeeded by Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 法兰西共和国的政府首脑职位。
description.en: The office of the head of government of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，其总理职位由夏尔·戴高乐接替。
description.en: French politician who was succeeded as Prime Minister by Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 由夏尔·戴高乐在第二次世界大战期间于伦敦建立的法国抵抗组织与流亡政府。
description.en: A French resistance organization and government-in-exile established in London by Charles de Gaulle during World War II.

nodes.id: 法兰西共和国临时政府

zh-cn: 法兰西共和国临时政府
en: Provisional Government of the French Republic

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战后解放法国期间的临时政府，由夏尔·戴高乐担任主席。
description.en: An interim government during the liberation of France after World War II, chaired by Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，在夏尔·戴高乐辞职后接任法兰西共和国临时政府主席。
description.en: French politician who succeeded Charles de Gaulle as President of the Provisional Government of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 位于西欧的共和国，是夏尔·戴高乐的祖国。
description.en: A republic in Western Europe, the homeland of Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐的父亲，一位拉丁语、哲学与文学教师。
description.en: Father of Charles de Gaulle, a teacher of Latin, philosophy, and literature.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐的母亲。
description.en: Mother of Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 法国元帅，夏尔·戴高乐的早期上司和提携者，两人关系后因《法国与她的军队》一书的署名问题而恶化。
description.en: Marshal of France, an early superior and mentor to Charles de Gaulle. Their relationship deteriorated over authorship issues concerning the book 'France and Her Army'.

description.zh-cn: 法国将军，在第一次世界大战初期指挥第五军团，戴高乐所在的第33步兵团隶属其麾下。
description.en: French general who commanded the Fifth Army at the beginning of World War I, under which de Gaulle's 33rd Infantry Regiment served.

nodes.id: 米哈伊尔·图哈切夫斯基

zh-cn: 米哈伊尔·图哈切夫斯基

description.zh-cn: 苏联元帅，在第一次世界大战期间作为战俘时，曾向夏尔·戴高乐学习法语。
description.en: Marshal of the Soviet Union who, as a prisoner of war during World War I, learned French from Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐的妻子。
description.en: Wife of Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐于1934年发表的军事理论著作，主张建立一支由坦克组成的机械化职业部队。
description.en: A military theory book published by Charles de Gaulle in 1934, advocating for the creation of a professional mechanized army composed of tanks.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，曾支持夏尔·戴高乐的建军思想，并在1940年任命戴高乐为国防次长。
description.en: French politician who supported Charles de Gaulle's military ideas and appointed him Under-Secretary for National Defence in 1940.

description.zh-cn: 法国将军，时任陆军参谋长，反对夏尔·戴高乐关于建立职业军的理论。
description.en: French general, then Chief of Staff of the Army, who opposed Charles de Gaulle's theory on creating a professional army.

description.zh-cn: 德国政治家，纳粹德国元首。其领导的德军于1940年占领巴黎。
description.en: German politician and Führer of Nazi Germany. The German forces he led occupied Paris in 1940.

description.zh-cn: 法国将军，反对夏尔·戴高乐关于建立独立坦克师的想法。
description.en: French general who opposed Charles de Gaulle's idea of creating independent armored divisions.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，时任战争部长，在保罗·雷诺的请求下同意晋升夏尔·戴高乐为上校。
description.en: French politician and Minister of War who, at the request of Paul Reynaud, agreed to promote Charles de Gaulle to colonel.

description.zh-cn: 法国政治家，时任总理，未认同夏尔·戴高乐主动进攻的建军方案。
description.en: French politician and Prime Minister who did not agree with Charles de Gaulle's military plan emphasizing offensive action.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐于1938年出版的著作，因署名问题导致其与菲利普·贝当的关系恶化。
description.en: A book published by Charles de Gaulle in 1938, which led to the deterioration of his relationship with Philippe Pétain due to authorship issues.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战期间纳粹德国在法国南部建立的傀儡政权。
description.en: A puppet state established by Nazi Germany in southern France during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐通过英国广播公司发表的演讲，号召法国人民抵抗纳粹德国的占领。
description.en: A speech delivered by Charles de Gaulle via the BBC, calling on the French people to resist the Nazi German occupation.

description.zh-cn: 英国首相，在第二次世界大战期间与夏尔·戴高乐签订关于自由法国章程的议定书。
description.en: British Prime Minister who signed an agreement with Charles de Gaulle regarding the charter of Free France during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 法国将军，曾受美国支持，与夏尔·戴高乐共同担任法兰西民族解放委员会主席，后被戴高乐排挤。
description.en: French general supported by the United States, who served as co-president of the French Committee of National Liberation with Charles de Gaulle before being marginalized by him.

nodes.id: 法兰西民族解放委员会

zh-cn: 法兰西民族解放委员会

description.zh-cn: 法国将军，在夏尔·戴高乐的领导下，其部队率先进入巴黎，参与解放巴黎的行动。
description.en: French general who, under the leadership of Charles de Gaulle, led the first Allied troops into Paris during its liberation.

description.zh-cn: 法属阿尔及利亚发生的政治危机，导致夏尔·戴高乐重新掌权并建立法兰西第五共和国。
description.en: A political crisis in French Algeria that led to Charles de Gaulle's return to power and the establishment of the French Fifth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 前法国驻日大使，夏尔·戴高乐的亲信，曾被派往台湾与蒋中正沟通法国与中华人民共和国建交事宜。
description.en: Former French ambassador to Japan and a confidant of Charles de Gaulle, who was sent to Taiwan to communicate with Chiang Kai-shek regarding France's establishment of diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国总统，在法国与中华人民共和国建交时，拒绝了法国提出的维持领事级外交关系的建议。
description.en: President of the Republic of China who, when France established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China, rejected France's proposal to maintain consular-level diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 1968年5月在法国发生的一系列学生抗议和罢工事件，动摇了戴高乐政府的统治。
description.en: A series of student protests and strikes in France in May 1968 that shook the de Gaulle government.

nodes.id: 削弱参议院权力修宪案

zh-cn: 削弱参议院权力修宪案
en: constitutional amendment to weaken the Senate

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐于1969年提出的一项宪法修正案，旨在削弱法国参议院的权力。该案在公投中被否决，直接导致戴高乐辞职。
description.en: A constitutional amendment proposed by Charles de Gaulle in 1969 to reduce the powers of the French Senate. Its rejection in a referendum led directly to de Gaulle's resignation.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐担任法兰西第五共和国的第一任总统。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle served as the first President of the French Fifth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 在夏尔·戴高乐担任总统期间，米歇尔·德勃雷是其任命的总理。
description.en: Michel Debré was the appointed Prime Minister during Charles de Gaulle's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 在夏尔·戴高乐担任总统期间，乔治·蓬皮杜是其任命的总理。
description.en: Georges Pompidou was the appointed Prime Minister during Charles de Gaulle's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 在夏尔·戴高乐担任总统期间，莫里斯·顾夫·德姆维尔是其任命的总理。
description.en: Maurice Couve de Murville was the appointed Prime Minister during Charles de Gaulle's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐接替勒内·科蒂成为法国总统。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle succeeded René Coty as President of France.

description.zh-cn: 乔治·蓬皮杜在夏尔·戴高乐辞职后接任法国总统。
description.en: Georges Pompidou succeeded Charles de Gaulle as President of France after his resignation.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐担任法兰西第四共和国最后一任总理。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle served as the last Prime Minister of the French Fourth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 在勒内·科蒂担任总统期间，夏尔·戴高乐是其任命的总理。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle was the appointed Prime Minister during René Coty's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐接替皮埃尔·弗林姆兰成为法国总理。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle succeeded Pierre Pflimlin as Prime Minister of France.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐是自由法国运动的领导人。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle was the leader of the Free French movement.

relationships.target: 法兰西共和国临时政府

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐担任法兰西共和国临时政府主席。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle served as the President of the Provisional Government of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 费利克斯·古安接替夏尔·戴高乐成为法兰西共和国临时政府主席。
description.en: Félix Gouin succeeded Charles de Gaulle as President of the Provisional Government of the French Republic.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐撰写并发表了《建立职业军》一书，阐述其军事思想。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle wrote and published the book 'The Army of the Future', explaining his military ideas.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐制定新宪法，成立了法兰西第五共和国。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle established the French Fifth Republic by drafting a new constitution.

description.zh-cn: 由于以法国共产党为首的左派反对他加强总统权力的宪法，夏尔·戴高乐被迫辞去临时政府总理职务。
description.en: Due to opposition from the left-wing, led by the French Communist Party, to his constitution aimed at strengthening presidential power, Charles de Gaulle was forced to resign as Prime Minister of the provisional government.

description.zh-cn: 阿尔及利亚战争导致法兰西第四共和国陷入危机，促使夏尔·戴高乐重返政坛。
description.en: The Algerian War plunged the French Fourth Republic into crisis, prompting Charles de Gaulle's return to politics.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐委托制定了法兰西第五共和国的新宪法。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle commissioned the drafting of the new constitution for the French Fifth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐支持法国发展独立的核武器力量。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle supported France's development of an independent nuclear weapons force.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐反对英国加入欧洲经济共同体，并努力减少英国在欧洲的影响。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle opposed the United Kingdom's entry into the European Economic Community and worked to reduce British influence in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 因拒绝将法国核武及军队整合到北约架构，夏尔·戴高乐宣布法国退出北约的统一军事指挥机构。
description.en: Due to his refusal to integrate French nuclear weapons and military into the NATO framework, Charles de Gaulle announced France's withdrawal from NATO's integrated military command structure.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐的思想和政策被称为戴高乐主义。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle's ideas and policies are known as Gaullism.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐于1909年考入圣西尔军校，1912年毕业。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle was admitted to the Saint-Cyr military academy in 1909 and graduated in 1912.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐在第33步兵团服役时，菲利普·贝当时任团长。
description.en: When Charles de Gaulle served in the 33rd Infantry Regiment, Philippe Pétain was the regimental commander.

description.zh-cn: 在第一次世界大战初期，第33步兵团隶属于第五军团。
description.en: At the beginning of World War I, the 33rd Infantry Regiment was part of the Fifth Army.

description.zh-cn: 在第一次世界大战初期，第五军团由夏尔·朗勒扎克将军指挥。
description.en: At the beginning of World War I, the Fifth Army was commanded by General Charles Lanrezac.

relationships.target: 米哈伊尔·图哈切夫斯基

description.zh-cn: 在战俘营期间，夏尔·戴高乐教米哈伊尔·图哈切夫斯基法语。
description.en: During his time as a prisoner of war, Charles de Gaulle taught French to Mikhail Tukhachevsky.

description.zh-cn: 菲利普·贝当委任夏尔·戴高乐为其幕僚，提携了他。
description.en: Philippe Pétain appointed Charles de Gaulle to his staff, mentoring him.

description.zh-cn: 因《法国与她的军队》一书的署名问题，菲利普·贝当与夏尔·戴高乐的关系迅速恶化。
description.en: Due to authorship issues with the book 'France and Her Army', the relationship between Philippe Pétain and Charles de Gaulle deteriorated rapidly.

description.zh-cn: 保罗·雷诺与夏尔·戴高乐结识后，支持其建军思想，并在政治上帮助他。
description.en: After meeting Charles de Gaulle, Paul Reynaud supported his military ideas and helped him politically.

description.zh-cn: 时任陆军参谋长莫里斯·甘末林反对戴高乐《建立职业军》中的理论。
description.en: Then Chief of Staff of the Army Maurice Gamelin opposed the theories in de Gaulle's 'The Army of the Future'.

description.zh-cn: 马克西姆·魏刚将军反对建立独立的战车师，这是戴高乐建军思想的核心。
description.en: General Maxime Weygand opposed the creation of independent armored divisions, a core idea of de Gaulle's military theory.

description.zh-cn: 总理莱昂·布鲁姆未认同夏尔·戴高乐强调主动进攻的建军方案。
description.en: Prime Minister Léon Blum did not agree with Charles de Gaulle's military plan which emphasized offensive action.

description.zh-cn: 《慕尼黑协定》的签订令夏尔·戴高乐对法国政府的表现十分失望。
description.en: The signing of the Munich Agreement left Charles de Gaulle very disappointed with the French government's performance.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐拒绝接受与德国的停战协定，并组织自由法国运动以对抗维希法国傀儡政权。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle refused to accept the armistice with Germany and organized the Free French movement to oppose the Vichy France puppet regime.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐在伦敦通过英国广播公司发表了《6月18日呼吁》。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle delivered the 'Appeal of 18 June' from London via the BBC.

description.zh-cn: 英国广播公司播出了夏尔·戴高乐的《6月18日呼吁》。
description.en: The BBC broadcast Charles de Gaulle's 'Appeal of 18 June'.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐与丘吉尔首相签订了关于自由法国章程的议定书。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle signed an agreement with Prime Minister Churchill on the charter of Free France.

description.zh-cn: 美国支持亨利·吉罗将军。
description.en: The United States supported General Henri Giraud.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐在权力斗争中迫使亨利·吉罗专任军事职务，最终将其彻底清除出法兰西民族解放委员会。
description.en: In a power struggle, Charles de Gaulle forced Henri Giraud to focus solely on military duties, eventually removing him completely from the French Committee of National Liberation.

description.zh-cn: 菲利浦·勒克莱尔将军在夏尔·戴高乐的领导下指挥部队解放巴黎。
description.en: General Philippe Leclerc commanded troops to liberate Paris under the leadership of Charles de Gaulle.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐领导下的盟军解放了巴黎。
description.en: Allied forces under the leadership of Charles de Gaulle liberated Paris.

description.zh-cn: 1958年5月的政治危机导致国民议会授予夏尔·戴高乐全权，使其重新上台。
description.en: The political crisis of May 1958 led the National Assembly to grant full powers to Charles de Gaulle, bringing him back to power.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐担任法兰西第四共和国最后一任总理，随后建立了法兰西第五共和国，结束了第四共和国。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle served as the last Prime Minister of the French Fourth Republic and subsequently established the French Fifth Republic, ending the Fourth Republic.

description.zh-cn: 贝志高是夏尔·戴高乐的亲信，被派往台湾执行外交任务。
description.en: Béatrix de Toulouse-Lautrec was a confidant of Charles de Gaulle, sent to Taiwan on a diplomatic mission.

description.zh-cn: 贝志高向蒋中正总统说明法国将与中华人民共和国建交。
description.en: Béatrix de Toulouse-Lautrec explained to President Chiang Kai-shek that France would establish diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐决定承认中华人民共和国为中国代表，并与之建交。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle decided to recognize the People's Republic of China as the representative of China and establish diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐决定停止承认中华民国为中国的代表政府。
description.en: Charles de Gaulle decided to cease recognizing the Republic of China as the representative government of China.

description.zh-cn: 蒋中正拒绝了法国在断交后维持领事级关系的提议。
description.en: Chiang Kai-shek rejected France's proposal to maintain consular-level relations after severing diplomatic ties.

description.zh-cn: 夏尔·戴高乐在访问加拿大期间公开发表“自由魁北克万岁”的演讲，被视为支持魁北克独立。
description.en: During his visit to Canada, Charles de Gaulle publicly gave a speech saying 'Vive le Québec libre!', which was seen as support for Quebec independence.

description.zh-cn: 戴高乐关于魁北克独立的言论导致法加关系陷入低谷，他本人也被加拿大政府列为不受欢迎人士。
description.en: De Gaulle's remarks on Quebec independence caused a downturn in France-Canada relations, and he was declared persona non grata by the Canadian government.

description.zh-cn: 五月风暴虽然未能直接推翻戴高乐政府，但暴露了深刻的社会矛盾，动摇了其统治基础，并间接导致了他次年的辞职。
description.en: Although May 68 did not directly overthrow the de Gaulle government, it exposed deep social conflicts, shook the foundations of his rule, and indirectly led to his resignation the following year.

relationships.source: 削弱参议院权力修宪案

description.zh-cn: 戴高乐提出的削弱参议院权力修宪案在公投中被否决，他因此宣布辞去总统一职。
description.en: The constitutional amendment proposed by de Gaulle to weaken the Senate was rejected in a referendum, leading him to announce his resignation as president.
